results.title: Led by Tesla, Auto Industry Rebounds as Car Sales Surge
results.abstract: Tesla reported record deliveries in the third quarter as growing interest in electric vehicles and other cars boosted sales across the industry.

multimedia.caption: Tesla’s new factory in China helped the company increase production and boost sales while its main factory in the United States was shut down for about two months in the spring.
Tesla’s new factory in China helped the company increase production and boost sales while its main factory in the United States was shut down for about two months in the spring.

results.title: A YouTuber Hangs His Own Shingle With an Auction Website
results.abstract: Doug DeMuro has a strong following for his giddy videos about exotic and quirky cars. Cars & Bids, his new site, got off to a roaring start.

multimedia.caption: Doug DeMuro has 3.7 million YouTube subscribers for his videos about cars. He recently branched out into an auction website.

results.title: Prosecutors Target Ex-Audi Chief in First VW Emissions Trial
results.abstract: Rupert Stadler is accused of continuing to sell cars with illegal software even after Volkswagen’s cheating scandal came to light.

multimedia.caption: The trial of Rupert Stadler, a former chief executive of Audi, will test whether prosecutors can convict top managers protected by layers of underlings.

results.title: 7 Things to Know About Your Used Car
results.abstract: Sales of previously owned vehicles are booming, but many new owners may not realize what they’re in for in terms of upkeep.

results.title: California Plans to Ban Sales of New Gas-Powered Cars in 15 Years
results.abstract: The proposal would speed up the state’s efforts to fight global warming at a time when California is being battered by wildfires, heat waves and other consequences of climate change.
results.byline: By Brad Plumer and Jill Cowan

multimedia.caption: Transportation remains California’s largest source of planet-warming emissions, accounting for roughly 40 percent of the state’s greenhouse gases from human activity.
Transportation remains California’s largest source of planet-warming emissions, accounting for roughly 40 percent of the state’s greenhouse gases from human activity.

results.title: Gavin Newsom: ‘We Decided to Pull the Band-Aid Off’
results.abstract: Twenty months into his term, California’s governor faces a pandemic and an environmental crisis. He speaks to Kara Swisher about his plan to save the “state of resistance.”

results.title: Elon Musk Promises to Make a $25,000 Tesla (in 3 Years)
results.abstract: Tesla said it was working on advances that would lower the cost of batteries and increase their capacity to store energy.

multimedia.caption: Tesla sells more electric cars than any other automaker, but its prices are beyond the reach of most people. A big breakthrough in battery technology could change that.

results.title: A Quadriplegic, a Specialty Van and a Lifetime of Adventures
results.abstract: A biking accident left Kirk Williams paralyzed, but he has traveled widely and inspired others to follow in his tire tracks.

multimedia.caption: Kirk Williams in Baja, Mexico. “When I take the lift out of the van,” he said, “everyone seems to stop what they’re doing to watch me.”

results.title: Head of Nikola, a G.M. Electric Truck Partner, Quits Amid Fraud Claims
results.abstract: Trevor Milton, founder and executive chairman of Nikola, resigned after an investment fund accused him of making false assertions about his company’s technology.
results.byline: By Neal E. Boudette and Jack Ewing

multimedia.caption: Trevor Milton founded Nikola in 2014 with a plan to produce zero-emission semi trucks that run on hydrogen fuel cells and batteries.

results.title: A Car Insurance Claim Estimate Before the Tow Truck Is Called
results.abstract: Using algorithms, tech companies are helping insurers speed up the process after an accident, make it more accurate and keep estimators out of the field — a plus during a pandemic.

multimedia.caption: Tractable’s algorithm “figures out the best combinations of pixel patterns that give it the most accuracy. It’s kind of magical, but it’s very data hungry,” a founder of the company said.

results.abstract: Japanese prosecutors say the former car executive helped Mr. Ghosn conceal his pay. For the world, the country’s court system itself could face judgment.

results.title: Looking to Buy a Used Car in the Pandemic? So Is Everyone Else
results.abstract: Eager to avoid public transit and Uber, and to save money, buyers are emptying dealerships.

results.title: A Nostalgic (if Isolating) Road Trip Along Route 66
results.abstract: Driven by an early fascination with the American West, a photographer set off to travel part of America’s most celebrated highway.

results.title: Ferrari Rolls Up Its Red Sleeves
results.abstract: Its Formula 1 team is in a slump, but the company C.E.O., Louis Camilleri, is making changes that he says will eventually pay off.

results.title: Endurance Racing With Cars That Belong in a Demolition Derby
results.abstract: Autos worth $500 or less have competed for 15 years in a circuslike race called 24 Hours of Lemons. Now electric vehicles have been invited, with no limit on spending.

results.title: Who Needs a $100,000 Car Right Now? Mercedes Thinks You Do
results.abstract: Defying the pandemic, the German carmaker began producing a new S-Class, one of its biggest moneymakers. But can it catch up to Tesla?

results.title: Dennis Williams, Former U.A.W. Leader, Is Accused of Conspiracy

results.abstract: With deliveries surging during the pandemic, carriers like UPS and FedEx and companies like Amazon are renewing their push toward electric vehicles.

results.title: Going Topless, Turning Heads
results.abstract: Station wagons outsell them, but convertibles hold a special place in the hearts of drivers, and automakers still offer a smorgasbord of models.

multimedia.caption: The new Mercedes-AMG S 63 Cabriolet. A $7,500 extra, the paint updates a historic Mercedes green from the 1950s and ’60s.

results.title: In Electric Car Market, It’s Tesla and a Jumbled Field of Also-Rans
results.abstract: Most traditional carmakers are struggling to produce and market electric vehicles even as Tesla sells hundreds of thousands of its luxury models.
des_facet: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
